Let's import the `FAS_litters.csv` csv using a relative path.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(haven)
```


```{r}
litters_df =
  read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")

litters_df =
  janitor::clean_names(litters_df)
```

Import the same dataset using an absolute path.

```{r}
litters_df_abs =
  read_csv("~/Desktop/P8105/data wrangling i/data/FAS_litters.csv")

litters_df_abs =
  janitor::clean_names(litters_df)
```

pups_df =

Importing the same set using an absolute path.

## Look at data

```{r}
litters_df

head(litters_df)

```

You can use `view`

```{r, eval = FALSE}
view(litters_df)
```

Look at a data summary

```{r}
str(litters_df)

skimr::skim(litters_df)
```

## Options in read_*

```{r}
litters_df =
  read_csv(
    "data/FAS_litters.csv",
    skip = 10, col_names = FALSE)
```

Looking at NA values.

```{r}
litters_df =
  read_csv(
    "data/FAS_litters.csv",
    na = c("NA", 19))
```

Column types


```{r}
litters_df =
  read_csv(
    "data/FAS_litters.csv",
    col_types =
      cols(
        `GD0 Weight` = col_character()
      ))
```


## Other file types

Import a xlsx file first.

```{r}
mlb_df =
  read_excel("data/mlb11.xlsx")
```

Import a SAS file.

```{r}
pulse_df =
  read_sas("data/public_pulse_data.sas7bdat")
```

## Base R ...

don't do this.

```{r, eval = FALSE}
litters_df =
  read.csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")
```

## Export data

We have code that "cleans" data and we need to export the clean dataset.

```{r}
litters_df_cleaned =
  read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")

litters_df_cleaned =
  janitor::clean_names(litters_df_cleaned)

write_csv(litters_df_cleaned, "data/litters_cleaned.csv")
```
